title: Show HN: I designed an espresso machine and coffee grinder
author: smeeeeeeeeeeeee
aiHeadline: In a shocking turn of events, someone actually used their engineering skills for good and designed an espresso machine and coffee grinder that doesn't look like it was built by a time-traveling Victorian, because who needs sleep when you can have a perfectly brewed cup of coffee to fuel your late-night coding sessions, am I right?

title: Android XR
author: dagmx
aiHeadline: Google just announced Android XR, because what the world really needed was another platform to make our lives more complicated, but hey, at least now you can experience the thrill of augmented reality on your Android device, if you can figure out how to use it without getting a headache, that is.

title: A new video captures a 1968 demo of IBMâ€™s Executive Terminal
author: sohkamyung
aiHeadline: Get ready for a blast from the past: a new video has surfaced of a 1968 demo of IBM's Executive Terminal, which is basically the equivalent of your grandparents showing you their old flip phone and saying 'this is how we used to do it back in my day', but with more mainframes and less Snapchat.

title: Carta is making it too difficult to cancel subscriptions, some founders say
author: impish9208
aiHeadline: Carta, the company that's supposed to make managing investments easier, is being accused of making it too difficult to cancel subscriptions, which is like being trapped in some kind of never-ending software update loop, except instead of just restarting your computer, you have to deal with actual human customer support, and we all know how fun that is.

title: Microsoft Recall still storing credit card, social security numbers
author: geekinchief
aiHeadline: Microsoft Recall is still storing credit card and social security numbers, because who needs data security when you can have the thrill of possibly having your identity stolen, and let's be real, it's not like you're going to notice anything until you're trying to buy a house and suddenly your credit score is in the toilet, at which point you'll be like 'oh wait, I think I know why this is happening...'
